intro: Eremanthus jelskii, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and narrow leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in panicles. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and lowland areas. Eremanthus jelskii has been used by Māori for centuries for its strong, fibrous leaves, which were used to make clothing and other crafts.
